topNews.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq 100, Dow Jones Forecast for the Week Ahead
topNews.description: Stocks look to have temporarily bottomed this past week with a strong reversal, but it isn't expected to last for an extended period.

authors.name: Paul Robinson
authors.title: Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2016</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: More Technical</li> <li>Time Frame: Medium-Term (2 Days to 2 Weeks)</li> <li>Type: Swing</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>20 years of experience in trading and analysis in equities, futures, options, and FX</li> <li>Worked over a decade as a proprietary trader for Schonfeld, JGM Securities, and Torus Capital LLC, operating in several markets – equities/options, futures, interest rates, and FX. Worked at FXCM for 5 years in various analytical and trading roles.</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“You could have the most insightful analysis and robust trading strategies, but if your mind isn’t ‘right’, then none of it will matter. With time I learned the importance of spending a significant portion of my time on the mental game and less on the ‘fun stuff’, like analyzing data and charts.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2016. Experience: 20 years of experience in trading and analysis in equities, futures, options, and FX. Worked over a decade as a proprietary trader for Schonfeld, JGM Securities, and Torus Capital LLC, operating in several markets – equities/options, futures, interest rates, and FX. Worked at FXCM for 5 years in various analytical and trading roles.

topNews.title: Bitcoin, Ether Doom or Gloom : Is Terra the Death of Digital Assets?
topNews.description: Cryptocurrency remains indecisive after a week of turmoil and economic havoc. Bitcoin finds support above $30,000 but will Terra bounce back?
topNews.newsKeywords: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Crypto, Luna, Tether, Terra, Stablecoins

authors.name: Tammy Da Costa
authors.title: Analyst
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2019</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: More Technical</li> <li>Time Frame: Short Term (Up to 2 Days)</li> <li>Type: Swing</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Started trading in 2008 as part of an Investment Challenge</li> <li>Has worked in the Financial sector since 2013 for banks such as Investec and FNB</li> <li>Joined IG in 2016 as a sales trader and progressed to move to DailyFX in 2019 as a market writer</li> </ul>  <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Economics and Econometrics</li> </ul>  <h2><strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“There is a fine line between confidence and arrogance and in trading, it is essential to know when that line is being crossed. Regardless of the amount of trading experience one has, risk management is always crucial to any trading strategy.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2019. Experience: Started trading in 2008 as part of an Investment Challenge. topNews.title: Australian Dollar Forecast: Jobs Report in Focus as Bear Market Pressures AUD/USD
topNews.description: The Australian Dollar fell, extending losses this past week. Will a jobs report revive some strength for AUD/USD? Technical and sentiment analysis seems to hint otherwise.
topNews.newsKeywords: Australian Dollar, AUD/USD, AUD/JPY, AU Jobs Report

authors.name: Daniel Dubrovsky
authors.title: Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2014</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: Technical and Fundamental</li> <li>Time Frame: Long-Term (Over 2 Weeks)</li> <li>Type: Position</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Began trading foreign exchange markets in 2016</li> <li>Started at DailyFX as an internship during college in 2014</li> <li>Hosted seminars, presented at the Chicago TradersEXPO in 2019</li> <li>Quoted by publications such as The Telegraph, Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq.com</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Holds a bachelor’s degree cum laude in Economics from San Francisco State University</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“A key lesson I developed as a trader is <a href="/forex/fundamental/article/special_report/2019/12/25/top-trading-lessons-the-critical-task-of-learning-to-lose-gracefully.html?ref-author=Dubrovsky">learning to lose gracefully</a>. I always start with proper risk management and exit scenarios before assessing my targets. This helps suppress emotion from one’s strategy when the market inevitably begins moving against you. In the long run, this means winning trades compensate for losing ones and is an important step towards being able to generate returns.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2014. Experience: Began trading foreign exchange markets in 2016. Started at DailyFX as an internship during college in 2014. Hosted seminars, presented at the Chicago TradersEXPO in 2019. Quoted by publications such as The Telegraph, Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq.com.

eu.title: Euro Technical Analysis: Consistent Narrative Forming for EUR/GBP, EUR/JPY, EUR/USD
eu.description: The major EUR-crosses are coalescing around a singular theme.
eu.newsKeywords: eur/usd rate forecast, eur/usd technical analysis, eur/usd rate chart, eur/usd chart, eur/usd rate, euro forecast, euro rate, euro rate forecast, euro to dollar, ecb rate expectations, ecb rate expectations, european central bank rate cut odds, ecb rate cut odds, coronavirus pandemic, covid-19

authors.name: Christopher Vecchio, CFA
authors.title: Senior Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2008</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: Technical and Fundamental</li> <li>Time Frame: Long-Term (2 weeks to 6 months)</li> <li>Type: Position</li> </ul> <p><a href=""/research/dna-fx"">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Started trading in equities in 2004 and FX in 2008</li> <li>Has worked with DailyFX since attending college in 2008 starting with an internship</li> <li>Has consulted multi-national firms on FX hedging and has lectured at Duke Law School on FX derivatives trading</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>B.A. in Economics & B.A. in Political Science from Lafayette College</li> <li>CFA charterholder as of August 2017</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“Trading is about taking decisive action, but you need to be divorced from your emotions. Getting married to a position in the market is a result of many cognitive biases interfering with a sound trading and investment strategy. It’s important to remain objective and be willing to admit defeat as soon as the evidence accumulates against your favor. It’s better to take a small loss and admit you were wrong than take a big loss because you insisted that you were right.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2008. Experience: Started trading in equities in 2004 and FX in 2008. Has worked with DailyFX since attending college in 2008 starting with an internship. Has consulted multi-national firms on FX hedging and has lectured at Duke Law School on FX derivatives trading.

asia.title: Crude Oil Lifted as US CPI Remains Stubbornly High and Risk Aversion Hits Equities
asia.description: Crude oil holds up despite the recent turmoil permeating other markets and a stubbornly high US CPI. Will WTI see a volatility break out?
asia.newsKeywords: Crude Oil, US Dollar, US CPI, Fed, USD/CNY

authors.name: Daniel McCarthy
authors.title: Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2021</h2> <h2><strong>Trading Style</h2></strong> <ul> <li>Analytical Style: Macro inter-market, fundamental and technical</li> <li>Time Frame: Medium-Long Term</li> <li>Type: Position</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Experience</h2></strong> <ul> <li>Commercial Bank FX price maker to clients and the inter-bank market</li> <li>Portfolio Manager handling currency exposure of Australia’s largest fund manager developing currency overlay programs</li> <li>Portfolio Manager with the Global Government Bond Fund</li> <li>Managed private capital using various strategies across equities, FX, commodities and rates</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</h2></strong> <p>Master of Business in Finance, University of Technology, Sydney</p> <p>Certificate IV in Training and Assessment</p> <h2><strong>Most Important trading Lesson Learned</h2></strong> <p>Plan the trade, then trade the plan. Always.</p>
authors.descriptionShort: Daniel McCarthy - Trading Style: Analytical Style: Macro inter-market, fundamental and technical, Time Frame: Medium-Long Term, Type: Position.

us.title: US Dollar Price Action Setups: EUR/USD, USD/JPY Breakdowns
us.description: The US Dollar has set a fresh 19-year high, helped along by another breakdown in EUR/USD. USD/JPY also turned and that remains of interest.

authors.name: James Stanley
authors.title: Senior Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2010</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: Technical and Fundamental </li> <li>Time Frame: Medium-Term (2 Days to 2 Weeks) </li> <li>Type: Event-Driven </li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Started working with equities in 1999, options in 2000 and FX in 2009</li> <li>Worked at Merrill Lynch, Fidelity and TD Ameritrade</li> <li>Frequent contributor to ZeroHedge.com</li> <li>Has spoken at numerous trader expos and conferences over the years</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Bachelor of Business Administration degree in Financial Services and Planning from Baylor University’s Hankamer School of Business</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“If you don’t manage your risk, it will manage you. Without a good defense, your offense doesn’t matter. And – hope is a terrible trading strategy.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2010. Experience: Started working with equities in 1999, options in 2000 and FX in 2009. Worked at Merrill Lynch, Fidelity and TD Ameritrade. Frequent contributor to ZeroHedge.com. Has spoken at numerous trader expos and conferences over the years.

technicalAnalysis.title: Gold Technical Forecast: Gold Price Collapse Testing Critical Support
technicalAnalysis.description: Gold prices collapsed for a fourth consecutive week with the plunge now attempting a break of key technical support. The levels that matter on the XAU/USD weekly chart.

authors.name: Michael Boutros
authors.title: Strategist
authors.descriptionLong: <h2><strong>At DailyFX Since:</strong> 2010</h2>  <h2><strong>Trading Style</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Analytical Profile: More Technical</li> <li>Time Frame: Medium-Term (2 Days to 2 Weeks)</li> <li>Type: Swing</li> </ul> <p><a href="/research/dna-fx">Can we guess your trading personality?</a></p>   <h2><strong>Experience</strong></h2> <ul>  <li>Nearly 20 years of experience trading FX, Commodities & Equity Indices</li> <li>15 years work experience on FX trade desks, brokers and at market news / trader websites including Forex.com, MG Financial, Velocity Trade and FXCM</li> <li>Michael has spoken at numerous trader expos and conferences over the years including Las Vegas, Dubai, Australia and New York.</li> <li>Sited by numerous financial publications including Reuters, Wall St Journal, CNBC and Bloomberg</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Education</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Economics / Philosophy</li> </ul>  <h2> <strong>Most Important Trading Lesson Learned</strong></h2>  <p>“There’s no Holy Grail in trading- it takes strategy, good risk management and most importantly, discipline. Respect the Technicals- It’s all about the setup. Know what you’re trying to do, in what time-frame and why. Always trade what you see, not what you hear and stay focused on the levels. Remember, price never lies.”</p>
authors.descriptionShort: At DailyFX Since: 2010. Experience: Nearly 20 years of experience trading FX, Commodities & Equity Indices. 15 years work experience on FX trade desks, brokers and at market news / trader websites including Forex.com, MG Financial, Velocity Trade and FXCM. Michael has spoken at numerous trader expos and conferences over the years including Las Vegas, Dubai, Australia and New York. Sited by numerous financial publications including Reuters, Wall St Journal, CNBC and Bloomberg.

technicalAnalysis.title: USD/CAD IG Client Sentiment: Our data shows traders are now net-long USD/CAD for the first time since May 05, 2022 20:00 GMT when USD/CAD traded near 1.28.
technicalAnalysis.description: Traders are further net-long than yesterday and last week, and the combination of current sentiment and recent changes gives us a stronger USD/CAD-bearish contrarian trading bias.

specialReport.title: Trend Trading | The Trend is Your Friend
specialReport.description: In this video you will learn about how a basic trendline and other technical indicators included in most charting packages can be useful for the purpose of determining the direction of the trend and how using multiple time frames, traders can determine the longer trend and then zero in on the most recent price action.

specialReport.title: Short SPX: Top Trade Opportunities
specialReport.description: As 2021 wound to a close, the animal spirits that had become the stock market for much of the previous year were being broken. Then in Q1 the market itself broke. The recent decline was deep, but hardly brutal.
